name: Artmore Hotel

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: This is a fun and cozy hotel. The kig bed in our room (#216) was very comfortable with soft, high quality bedding. The staff is friendly and went the extra mile for us on several counts when we chose to cook a Christmas eve dinner in our room's kitchen. They met all of our requests. Breakfast is also varied with various hot dishes, grits, cereal on real ceramic plates and cups! We will definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I reviewed the Artmore Hotel this past September. Management asked me to give them another chance, so I did.
reviews.title: Happy we came back and gave her another try. Love this boutique hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at this fun boutique hotel in the Arts District. I wanted to love this hotel first time, because it is a boutique hotel, relatively inexpensive, with vintage architecture and a fun outdoor bar. We came to Atlanta this time simply to get away from the city in which we live and to get away from the kids and the Christmas rush. We went to two special exhibits at the High Museum, we had two great meals at South City and Nan and we spent an afternoon with a great bartender at Article 14.
reviews.title: If You Are Ever In Atlanta, You Will Want to Stay Here!

reviews.text: We will come back to the Artmore. I highly recommend the loft suite rooms that are on the third floor but then the bedroom is on another floor above. It was such a nice, cozy place to hang out with my spouse. When it rains, you can hear the patter on the attic windows. I really love the energy that is in the public spaces at this hotel but I love the coziness of the rooms. The hotel is VERY clean and the staff is very friendly. The location simply cannot be beat if you are looking for great restaurants and entertainment. We parked our car on Friday evening and didn’t touch it again until we left on Sunday morning. This is a great hotel for the local concert venues, the museums, the fabulous nearby restaurants and the local club scene.
reviews.title: A pleasant business stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Artmore. If you have any issue at all, ask to speak to management. They will want to hear from you and make it right. This is my Atlanta hotel now. Feels like home and a fun place to stay. I am very happy to have found it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience!

description: A Boutique Hotel in Midtown Atlanta across the street from the Arts Center MARTA station. Near the High Museum, Fox Theater, Museum of Design & Architecture, Piedmont Park, Atlantic Station, Atlanta Botanical Garden and Center Stage performance venue. Close proximity to Downtown Atlanta and Buckhead. Renovated, dog Friendly, and LGBT-Friendly, with a great courtyard for relaxing or lounging. The Studio + Bar is a great place to gather and the Artmore Hotel is the place to stay in midtown Atlanta. For a unique experience also try our cocktail garden serving delicious bites along with Artmore's signature drinks.
